title: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh's annual compensation grew to Rs 66 crore in FY24
description: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh's annual compensation grew 17.3% in FY24 and reached nearly Rs 66 crore, as per the annual report of the company. In FY23, Parekh's salary was Rs 56.4 crore.
content: The annual compensation of Infosys chief executive officer and managing director, Salil Parekh, climbed more than a sixth last fiscal to reach Rs 66 crore, showed the FY24 annual report of the company.Parekh drew a salary of Rs 56.4 crore in FY23.Unlike last fiscal, when his remuneration actually fell by 21% to Rs 56.4 crore from Rs 71.02 crore in FY22, Parekh’s compensation expanded in FY24.This also makes him the second highest-paid IT CEO in FY24 after Wipro’s former chief Thierry Delaporte who earned $20 million (about Rs 166 crore) that included a severance-related package of Rs 92.1 crore. Recently, TCS said its CEO and MD K Krithivasan’s overall remuneration in FY24 was Rs 25.2 crore, slightly less than his predecessor Rajesh Gopinathan, who drew a salary of Rs 29.16 crore in FY23.
